name: Garlic Parmesan Breadsticks
author: OpenAI

reviews.txt: These breadsticks are amazing - perfectly soft and flavorful!
Easy to make and taste just like the ones from a restaurant.
Just go to Little Caesars instead.
A family favorite! We can't get enough of these.

recipe: Prepare the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let sit for 5-10 minutes until frothy.
Mix Ingredients: Add the olive oil, salt, and 2 cups of flour to the yeast mixture. Mix until a dough forms, adding more flour as needed.
Knead the Dough: Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
Let it Rise: Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a damp towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

Shape the Breadsticks: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Punch down the dough and divide it into 12 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 6-inch log and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Prepare the Topping: Mix the melted butter with garlic powder. Brush the breadsticks with half of the garlic butter mixture.
Bake: Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
Add Final Touches: Remove from the oven and immediately brush with the remaining garlic butter. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and dried parsley.
Serve: Allow the breadsticks to cool slightly before serving. Enjoy!
